document.docAuthor: Patello, Thyago J. C. & Ruiz, Gustavo R. S.
document.docTitle: Mago delicatus Patello & Ruiz, 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the acutidens group of Mago (Araneae: Salticidae: Amycinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the acutidens group of Mago (Araneae: Salticidae: Amycinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
male from Acampamento Mutum, Juruti, Pará, Brazil (
2.551917 °S
56.224722 °W
),
11 .VIII. 2010
, N. Abrahim ( MPEG 21023 ).
Paratypes :
one female from Platô do Rio Juruti, Juruti, Pará, Brazil (
2.466833 °S
56.211722 °W
),
07.IX. 2002
, A.B. Bonaldo & D.D. Guimarães ( MPEG 21151 ); one female from Beneficiamento, Juruti, Pará, Brazil (
2.507611 °S

),
12 .VII. 2010
, N.C. Bastos ( MPEG 21035 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The epithet is a Latin adjective and refers to the form of the embolus in the male palp, slender than in other species of the
acutidens
group.

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
M. similis
sp. nov.
and
M. balbina
sp. nov.
by having an acute median projection only on the prolateral side of the embolus. From
M. similis
sp. nov.
, it differs by the embolus tip, which is more straight and slender, and from
M. balbina
sp. nov.
, this species differs by having a shorter embolus, with the thinner tip being shorter than the embolus base (
Fig. 30
). Females of this species are very similar to those of
M. balbina
sp. nov.
, with smaller copulation openings (
Figs 32 –33, 35– 36
), but it is difficult to tell them apart. So far, the two species have not been found living at the same locality.

Description. Male ( holotype ).
Total length: 7.40 . Carapace 3.80 long, 2.60 wide and 2.00 high. Length of ocular quadrangle: 2.00; anterior eye row 2.60 wide, posterior 2.30 wide. Legs 3142 . Length of femur I: 2.40 ; II: 2.00; III: 3.10 ; IV: 2.25 ; patella+tibia I: 3.40 ; II: 2.50 ; III: 2.80 ; IV: 2.50 ; metatarsus+tarsus I: 2.25 ; II: 1.80 ; III: 2.30 ; IV: 2.50 .

Female ( paratype MPEG 21151 ).
Total length: 7.69 . Carapace 3.32 long, 2.18 wide, 1.80 high. Length of ocular quadrangle: 1.61 ; anterior eye row 2.18 wide, posterior 2.09 wide. Legs 4312 . Length of femur I: 1.75 ; II: 1.70 ; III: 2.40 ; IV: 2.00; patella+tibia I: 2.35 ; II: 2.00; III: 2.40 ; IV: 2.15 ; metatarsus+tarsus I: 1.60 ; II: 1.40 ; III: 2.00; IV: 2.80 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–22.
Mago jurutiensis
sp. nov.
19. teeth of male chelicera, retromesal view; 20. same, retrolateral view; 21. female epigynal plate, dissected, dorsal view; 22. same, detail of gland openings on copulation ducts.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Males (n= 10 ). Total length: 5.03–7.50 ; length of carapace: 2.85–3.80 ; length of leg I: 5.70–8.55 . Females (n= 10 ). Total length: 6.17–7.98 ; length of carapace: 2.85–3.61 ; length of leg I: 5.32–6.27 .
